bibl.title: Military Orders for John J. Moran, October 1, 1919

div1.p: Moran is honorable discharged from the United States Army.

div1.head: Military Orders for John J. Moran, October 1, 1919
div1.opener:
HEADQUARTERS EASTERN DEPARTMENT
Governors Island, New York,
October 1, 1919.
WDC-5-
SPECIAL ORDERS)
)
NO. 235)
div1.p:
Par. 1. By direction of the President, and under
the provisions of Section 9, Act of Congress, May 18, 1917, and Circular
No. 75, War Department, 1918, the following named officers are honorably
discharged from the service of the United States, for the convenience of
the Government, to take effect this date their services
being no longer required.
Captain John Joseph Moran, Quartermaster Corps,
div1.closer:
BY COMMAND OF GENERAL BARRY: WILLIAM WEIGEL,
Colonel, General Staff,
Chief of Staff. OFFICIAL:
H.O.S. HEISTAND,
Adjutant General,
Adjutant.
ACTIVE OFFICERS
DEC 8 1919
WIL. & FINAL PAY BRANCH
RECEIVED
DEC 9 1919
